data.title: Best Happy Hour!
data.text: The happy hour deals at Beacon are hard to beat.  Good food, good drink, great prices!  The bartender I had, Richard, is always a delight; he's recognized me for a few years now when I pay a visit to my friends and the city every 6 months.  The atmosphere is perfect - modern design, not too loud but not quiet or empty, folks dressed well but not snobby Hill staffers.

data.title: Enjoyable
data.text: Party of 4 for Brunch. Pleasant atmosphere , attentive wait staff, quality food. Nice selection of breakfast foods and lunch. Would have like to have more fish or meat choices for lunch for the price but you are paying  for the location and hotel. Enjoyed our brunch, will be back. Recommend making a reservation.

data.title: Good food, attentive service. Slightly outdated dining room.
data.text: Ate dinner here on a weeknight. The place was mostly empty. It looks like they tried to update the dining room without replacing the carpet/paneling, and it shows. Nonetheless, an acceptable dining room. Varied menu with interesting entrees. I had a a Caesar salad and the chicken with polenta and brussels sprouts. The Caesar was very good; just a hint of anchovy flavor. Croutons were bagged, but the bread on the table was fresh and hot. I didn't like the spices used on the chicken, but it was nicely prepared. The polenta was very good, and the brussels sprouts were amazing. Service was outstanding. Received a 20% discount because I was staying in the hotel. Would definitely eat here again.

data.title: Poor customer service
data.text: This place has really nice views of the city but I found the customer service (both table service and at the bar) to be very slow and rude. Food was whatever. Happy hour prices were decent. Overall I thought it was below average and I'm surprised at the good reviews. It also lacked any personality/ambience in my opinion. Pretty tourist-y.

data.title: Excellent food!
data.text: The meals we ate for breakfast, lunch and dinner were very good.  Generous food portions and good service.

data.title: Great for Chips
data.text: The chips (fries) were great and 1/2 price coctails every evening between 4-7pm. The staff are also very friendly and accomodating.

data.title: Average Fair at Luxary Prices
data.text: Food served was of average quality while the drinks were extremely expensive. Walk up the street to Constitution avenue for better deals.

data.title: Late dinner
data.text: It was late and the group decided to eat in rather than go out. I had the cheeseburger deluxe, it was OK, bacon was overcooked and splintered once bitten into to, no sparkling water to drink and the server was attentive (and apologetic)>

data.title: Best Chicken and Waffles Ever!!!
data.text: My party of 4 was seated right away on a Saturday around noon which was great! The 3 courses and bottomless mimosas drew me in and I was not disappointed. The Greek yogurt w/ fresh fruit and granola were delicious, my glass never stayed empty, but the Star was the chicken and waffles. The chicken was seasoned and fried perfectly; the waffle was delicious. This is the best I've had anywhere and I will be back. The service was awesome as well!

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: The American breakfast was really good! My sister ordered the steak and eggs, and said that it was delicious!!!! Yum!!!'

data.title: Good Variety - Sunday Buffet
data.text: The Sunday Brunch Buffet offered a good variety of food for the price. The omelet was cooked perfectly.  The carved beef was tough but everything else was pretty good

data.title: Great Meal, Bargain and Service!
data.text: We went there as part of Restaurant Week and were delighted at the menu, prices and service.  Unlike many places, they include unlimited champagne when you do the $35 restaurant week selection.  Also, rather than limit your selections to just a part of their menu, you can choose any appetizer, any entree and any dessert.  Our waiter, Tom, was delightful and very helpful—other service staff in DC should take a lesson from him.  I had grilled salmon and it was superb.  This is a great choice—I was concerned that it was a “hotel” restaurant, but my bias was unfounded.

data.title: Expensive but Yummy
data.text:
I love the Sunday Brunch at the Beacon Bar and Grill. What's not to love? Good food, including an omelet station and a waffle station, plenty of tasty bacon and fried chicken, not to mention the endless champagne, mimosas, and bloody marys. This is the way to have chicken and waffles, by the way... do it yourself at the buffet!

If you're lucky enough to have Desi as your server, you're in for a particularly delightful treat. She will make absolutely sure your glass never goes dry. She's practically perfect.

My husband and I have been doing Sunday Brunch at the Beacon on nearly every trip we make to DC. It's really good, so much better than most buffets. Sadly, through the years, we've watched the prices go up. This time, bunch for two, after tax and tip, was over $100. Sadly, we will have to consider more economical options in the future; plus, when I pay that much I feel obligated to guzzle champagne... and while I generally agree that too much of a good thing is a very good thing, perhaps too much champagne is too much.

data.title: Supper
data.text: Steak and salmon were wonderful. The salads were fresh and tasteful.  The cosmopolitan was perfect and beer was cold  😄🍸🍻

data.title: Skip desert and breakfast
data.text: We were staying in the hotel and had dinner and breakfast here. Dinner was fine, we had the salmon and the crab cakes. Desert wasn't great, they were out of cheesecake and the strawberry shortcake had like 3 strawberries. Breakfast really wasn't much, we had the continental breakfast and the granola. Both were really small portions.

data.title: 5 star!!!
data.text: OMG! This was the most amazing brunch I've ever experienced. Buffet style dining and all of the food was finger licking good. The selection was superb! They had everything from fruits and veggies to great southern style biscuits and gravy. The bottomless drink selection was great as well. Mimosas, champagne and cranberry, Bloody Mary, and bellinis. All for about 40 bucks. Kat and Kyle were or waiters and they did a marvelous job as the place was packed. Great Food, Great Service, def a 5 star establishment and I recommend anyone in DC to visit, I know I'll be back!

data.title: Truly bottomless Mimosas
data.text: The walk from our hotel was in a steady drizzle but was very much worth the walk.  We had a reservation for the Sunday Brunch and were seated upon arrival in the bar area - it was very warm as they had just cranked the heat up to take the chill out of the room.  It did cool down.  Our server CARLOS was OUTSTANDING!!!  Our "bottomless" glasses were never empty and he had a wicked sense of humor that we both enjoyed!  The buffet was outstanding with the standouts being the Chicken and Waffles, Mac 'n Cheese, Omelet Station and Chicken Enchiladas (we're from AZ and for us to say they were good THEY were good!)  The price for this brunch buffet is by far more than reasonable!  GREAT START TO OUR DAY!!!

data.title: Mother's Day Weekend Bust
data.text:
My friends and I got a hotel in the area near the Beacon and decided to have brunch there on Sat morning. That was a bad idea! The service was horrible! Our food took extra long to come out. The bottomless mimosas were okay but a few times I was sitting waiting for a refill. The food took almost an hour and a half. For breakfast food that ridiculous! We went to management (which appear to be two brothers) who had different management styles. One manager offered to give us our meal on the house while the other totally disagreed. We ended up taking the food and it was cold. It didn't even taste good. While all of this was going on one person in our party had already made us reservations to another restaurant. Did I mention that one person was still waiting on her food while everyone else had their cold food in front of them??? Yeah well the waiter came back to inform her that her plate had fallen on the floor. At that point everyone put their forks down and we left. Oh and it was only a party of 4. You would have thought we had 10 people in our party or something. 

It makes no sense that in this day and age you would receive such poor service when there are so many GrEAT places to eat in Washington DC area!!!! You never have to worry about me returning to that restaurant again!!!  

The food was nasty we ordered steak and eggs, salmon, & pancakes. The chicken and waffles never made it out! The service was horrible. Except for the one manager. And the atmosphere was not great either. All in all it was bad!

data.title: Mothers Day Brunch
data.text:
We had a wonderful Mothers Day brunch today. The breakfast items were amazing and the roast beef and fried chicken were perfect. The salad offers were fresh and wonderful. The waffles are worth the trip.  I will say for a brunch as wonderful as this the desserts were disappointing. 

My complaint would be the room where the food was set up was small for the number of people there today. It's probably fine for normal Sunday brunch but today was not.  

We will come back to brunch here when we are in the city again.

data.title: Brunch
data.text: Came here on a Sunday for the brunch buffet. The food was amazing especially the berry kale salad. The waitress was terrible, unfriendly and when asking for a refill it was like pulling teeth. The place can get very noisy and hard to talk by the end of the day. Great place for a get together.
